text: greetings my name is Matt word and I'm
here at the AWS headquarters in Seattle
to give you an update on the Amazon web
application firewall or Waf AWS WF gives
you control over which traffic to allow
or block to your web applications by
defining web security rules and you can
use W to create custom rules that block
common attack patterns such as SQL
injection and we just added a new way to
match and manage cross-site scripting
cross-site scripting enables attackers
to inject client side scripts into web
pages viewed by other unsuspecting users
and with WF you can now create rules
that let you allow block or count
requests that appear to contain
malicious cross- siiz scripting attacks
we've also added some new tutorials for
automating web application security such
as protecting from distributed denial of
service attacks and how to respond to
scrapers and troll Bots you'll find more
on our site that's it thanks a lot
